title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Arranged an interview but canceled just one night before the meeting without any explanation just got an email said sorry we need to cancel the interview… I don’t have 30 word to describe a nonexistent interview process.
Interview Questions: No interview. Canceled with no explanation.

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Applied, waited for a month, then got a request for an interview. After another month I got the rejection letter Two main complaints: 1. The 1 month response time between each stage 2. I expected know-it-all snobs going into the interview. That's what I got. No surprise there. But this interview was pretty special. They take themselves way too seriously. Do you really need a SIX-person panel to interview someone for a below-market wage developer job?? I only did the interview for practice and I'm baffled by this. There were two interviewers in particular that seemed so distant emotionally, and out of place in the panel. They seemed unhappy and distracted by other things. As it came to their turn to ask questions, they seemed almost robotic, the way they greeted me and asked me their questions as if going off a script. The questions this pair asked were so generic and served no purpose in prying the candidate for talent. See below. There were some interviewers that knew what they were talking about and we had some good conversations going. Overall, a very pretentious and extra silicon valley mindset. Horrible interviewers. Would not in a MILLION years take the offer of being on their team ESPECIALLY with a salary below 100K.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you use a frontend framework to change something on the screen? - Male robot Q: How do you use a backend framework to achieve something? - Female robot

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was initiated after you submitted a website application with cover letter. After that, I was contacted by the lab and we proceeded with an initial phone interview. The interview consisted of some general behavioral questions and then a technical interview gauging my background in wet-lab skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Questions were easy and interviewer was really nice. She gave me cookies and I really loved them, and she loved me too like Barney from Barney and Friends. Yes that was my favorite childhood show i loveed it sooooo much i just wanna hug him and kiss him
Interview Questions: What's the square root of pi?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Stock Island, FL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: very easy and straights to the point, didnt take alot of time and got a call the next day and got accepted, liked the questions and the easy going questions.
Interview Questions: What items would you bring with you if you were stranded on an island?

title: Senior Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Online system blocked my email.  Sent message to Caltech help email who responded saying use another email.  I used my backup email and submitted the application.  Caltech responded to my original blocked email to catch my attention and schedule a call.  Brief screening call from the manager went fine. Followed by a 9-person video call interview, days later, which lasted over one hour (same manager + 8 physical scientists). Interview was 98% fine and mostly behavior questions, some technical computing questions, questions about my experience. Mostly a relaxed tone and professional exchange. The Americans seemed to not care at all sharing a lazy attitude, the foreigners were completely opposite and appreciated their workplace. All physical scientists were top notch researchers and IT staff, and were very capable professionals (which matched my level). Lone manager was a very different story. Manager announced that “You need to get yelled at” in a bullying tone, on camera in front all members. I gave him an odd look, kept cool and proceeded with the interview. Very strange comment for a candidate and was not expecting it. Manager said we’ll follow up with you within two weeks, on camera looking at me. Follow-up phone call by me was ignored. They’ve been ghosting me for +4 months, republished the identical job description several times, and obviously lied about their following up. It’s obvious Caltech has an "incompetent, bully manager" problem.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grant Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: HR interview with the manager then an interview the professor you would work with. I got to step two. The guy who interviewed me made it clear that the professors were difficult to work with.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
WHat is your experience working with research grants?

title: Staff Services Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: It had a great environment  and had tine to think about all questions. They gave me all questions so i could read them  and think about them . Questions were fare and wasn't so technical. More behave  questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Science Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Fairfield, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Online interview with hiring manager, two supervisors, scientist, another educator. They asked questions that were mostly about how you are at the workplace and how you interact with other people. The first question was the "tell us about yourself" one.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: it went by fast.  Don't let you talk.  you have to walk the whole campus to get to a place.  Nobody knows anything. they all blank.  don't know what they are doing.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: It was alright. Supervisors were very positive, but some red flags emerged indicative of dysfunctional work culture. Overall, I would say go for it, but be aware of what you are getting into.
Interview Questions: How long have you been working in x field?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Discuss objective of project, experience required, went over resume to make sure there was a match in skills and experience required. Casual, chatted about lab's published papers and that was about it. Getting the interview itself was probably the most difficult part
Interview Questions: What is your experience level with EEG systems?

title: PhD, Chemistry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty short and straightforward (only 15 minutes). They asked me why I wanted to study Chemistry, what my most significant research experience was, which project I found the most interesting. They asked me what scientific question I wanted to answer with my PhD, and they wanted to know what my goals were after graduation.
Interview Questions: They asked me why I wanted to study at Caltech.

title: Ressearch assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Asked to prepare and present 10 slides of current research summary for the PI and the lab to assess.  Toured the lab with the PI two days later to meet with lab members, and received tour of campus and proteomics facility
Interview Questions:
What is your skill set?
What are your career goals?

title: Telescope Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview started with an introduction of all involved and the they described the type of work I would be doing. It was a relaxed interview and the questions were kept to a minimal.
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience using Java and Python? How well versed are you in those?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone with a few people asking questions and then video call.  Five people on call with degrees of difficulty.  Most people whom were there for many years.   It took about 1 month before getting notice they chose someone else.
Interview Questions: General DBA and specific Geo Spatial

title: Research Assitant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was professional. 30 minutes long. The job itself assisted with a lab in the biology department looking for a remote research assistant to help with the lab's research. The interviewer asked basic questions and explained her research briefly.
Interview Questions:
-Previous background
-What interests are and future plans
-Any programming language experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: I don't even remember man this was 5 years ago. You apply and then they offer your acceptance or whatever to come "interview" at visiting weekend but that was a joke and they're more just trying to rope you into doing 5+ years of cheap-as-dirt labor for them so unless you're totally incompetent you'll probably be fine and even if you're totally incompetent but reasonably teachable (ie: me) then you'll still be fine. They just want you there to work for them for cheap cheap cheap
Interview Questions: HeY wHy YoU wAnNa Do ReSeArCh HeRe????

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with two supervisors that asked a variety of typical interview questions, what are my good qualities, describe a difficult situation you experienced at work and how did I handle it, what were the results of the situation. Additional questions about my experience and how my qualifications apply to the job I am interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What are my good qualities that apply to the position.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Caltech website, had several phone interviews, followed by in-person all day interviews with several professors - mainly it was to see if I could work well with others.  The fact that I didn't have a background didn't seem to matter to them- it was more about organizational skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this department

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Called out to meet at the location twice and was called by them multiple times in the following weeks.  Process was not hard but required a lot of one on one to make sure I was a good fit.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous lab experience?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: I meet with another staff member initially they  gave me a tour of the workplace, I then met with my supervisor who interviewed me for ~30 minutes. Next I met with individual lab members who also interviewed me (although less formally)
Interview Questions: Asked about my undergraduate research experience.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: First video interview with the PI and then separate video interview with the lab group. The conversations were focused on my research interests and what I hope to get out of working as a technician at Caltech. These were followed-up by a phone call conversation with the PI. The PI wanted to make sure I could handle the responsibility of taking care of routine tasks for the students in the lab.
Interview Questions: Describe your research experience.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I interviewed a skype interview and an onsite interview at CALTECH. In the skype interview, I met several members and in the onsite interview, I met several professors. One professor started the argument without reason and rationale. However, I replied to his emotional questions without tension.
Interview Questions: Techniques, Experience, Management Skills, The Previous Projects

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Process was very easy. Met with HR just so that they could take me to the hiring manager. The interview was up to the discretion of the manager so I believe each interview is unique.
Interview Questions: I had to give a presentation on my previous work.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: it depends on your advisor you are going to work with. In my case, my advisor knows well about my work and we like to work together on some exciting project. So it is quite easy for me to get the job for the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your detailed plan of research for this postdoc time?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. Just submit online applications together with reference letters. The process took approximately 2-3 months. The application deadline is mid December. I got the offer at the end of March.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grad Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: None for chemistry. This varies by department but chemistry programs across the country do not typically require an interview. Only the Application is reviewed and a yes/no decision is made.
Interview Questions: Publications, GRE, statement of purpose

title: Fixed Asset Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Interview Process: 
1.	apply online, set up phone interview for prescreening
2.	wait for recruiter to let you know whether to proceed with the in person interview and perform excel testing
3.	if hired, they’ll contact you.
Interview Questions:
1. What interests you about this position? 
2. What is your day to day excel experience?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I responded to a posting on the Techerlink, met up with the professor to talk about the project, and got the part-time job. He described to me the time commitment and on-boarding process that would be required.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a programming project

title: Catering General Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The person interviewing me was nice and straightforward about what they were looking for. There weren't any stupid generic interview questions, which was nice. Was professional through and through, but also straightforward and pleasant. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at caltech?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: I had two round of interviews. One to One with the hiring manager and a another was a panel interview. Interviewers were really nice and helpful and made me feel comfortable throughout the whole process.
Interview Questions: Mostly questions were around my previous experience. There were also some behavior related questions

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very informal-- it typically involves presenting your previous work in front of the lab / research group you are planning to join, then go through a series of one-on-one meetings to discuss research interests and prior experiences. The overall process may vary greatly though depending on the particular research group / department you are planning to join.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? How would you design an experiment to test this particular hypothesis?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the professor, and talked to him in person about the project. Then I wrote a proposal with his guidance, and applied for the program.  The program is not hard to apply to as long as the professor decide to take you in.
Interview Questions: Research I have participated before. My interest. My skill.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Too quick, too good to be true. The interview process was very casual, very laid back. They asked the same very usual vague questions asked by every employer; where do you see yourself 5 years from now. What do you do to stay up to date. Describe your experience with your last employer. Why did you decide to leave.
Interview Questions: They asked the basic questions, the usual vague questions asked by employers that really don't tell much about the Candidate's personality.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It's a full day process, met with PI, gave a presentation, then talk individually with every lab members. Since I came from a totally different background, there was no difficult questions. At the end, I was told that an official offer will be made once the PI got feedback from lab members. Overall very pleasant experience
Interview Questions:
What's your career plan?
How long do you intend to stay in this position

title: Summer Undergraduate Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Reached out to a professor who invited me to interview, asked me what my skills were and took a resume, then had me summarize the project he pitched to me back to him. Was hired a few days later after competing with another candidate. I had to write a page long summary which morphed into my proposal draft. This resulted in me getting the job over the other candidate .
Interview Questions: What programming experience do you have?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Full Day 9am - 9pm. I had a meeting with the primary faculty and then meetings with the subdivisions of the research group. Several senior faculty and a postdoc took me to lunch and then I gave a 50 min presentation of my doctoral research. Afterwards, I met with more group members until the middle of the afternoon and then had an exit interview with the primary faculty. That evening, I attended a group social function.
Interview Questions: Would you be wiling to oversee and mentor graduate students and undergraduate students?

title: Sustainability Assisotate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was a phone interview with someone from the human resource department. She only asked three basic questions. Very simple. 

Second interview was a phone interview with the sustainability director at Caltech. We spoke for around an hour.  The interview was mostly experienced based questions with a couple of situational questions. The conversation flowed very well and was somewhat casual. A very positive interviewing experience.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with LEED building certifications?

title: Grad Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: There was a personal statement, submission of grades, and letters of recommendation component in the application. All of this was done in an online application. Having a caltech connection is useful for getting in.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Hired from postdoc position into staff role.   Must have PhD from top tier research institution.  Letters of recommendation go a long way towards distinguishing you from your peers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Summer Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Sent an e-mail requesting that I meet with the professor after a lab tour. He accepted, and we had a short interview. The interview process was more like him telling me what are some of the jobs that he is looking to fill, and discussing the projects that he would like finished.
Interview Questions: I was a freshman at the time, and the questions were not difficult, rather more general.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Most likely to get a job through professional networking. If invited for an interview be prepared to give an hour-long talk to a specialized audience of up to 50 people. Be ready to defend your subject. Have in-depth knowledge of the lab you are applying to. Also be prepared to ask pertinent questions during a lab tour.
Interview Questions: During the job talk, I was asked a technical question about a very specific aspect of my research.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application online, I was contacted by one of the Professors I had expressed interest in working with. He asked if we could have a Skype interview. The interview was informal and we mostly discussed my previous research experience and reasons for wanting to start a Ph.D. program at Caltech.
Interview Questions: Describe past research experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Phone interview, followed by a test of technical knowledge and writing skills - assigned a paper to read and summarize.
Interview Questions: Why my laboratory in particular?

title: Summer Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Met one-on-one with a professor in the related field. Overall, not very technical and more focused on interest and fit.
Interview Questions: Typical fit questions.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Send the application to graduate studies office. No interview for the engineering department.
Interview Questions: Why are you here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: I did not get an interview. The process is high dependent on the departments. Some departments such as bio may require onsite interview. Basically you need to get an excellent GPA, and very good research background, good recommendations to get admitted. I think the personal statement is very important. Contacting professors before submitting your application is helpful.
Interview Questions: NA-I did not get an interview. The process is high dependent on the departments. Some departments such as bio may require onsite interview. Basically you need to get an excellent GPA, and very good research background, good recommendations to get admitted. I think the personal statement is very important. Contacting professors before submitting your application is helpful.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received a quick feedback on the application. I was shortlisted for the position and got an interview over skype. After a couple of weeks I received the offer. There was no room for negotiation, and I accepted the contract, even if I had a competing offer with a higher salary.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of what I expected. A lot of bureaucracy for accepting the offer.

title: Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Livingston, LA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Full day of interviewing. It was a three person panel interview with a tour, then the panel too me to lunch. I met with another larger panel of peers. The day was closed with a meeting with the director.
Interview Questions: What experience I had with hands on tools, machine work and equipment operation?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: As a general interview process as happened in my interview, you are supposed to give a talk to the group and show your expertise in the field. Depending on the group, the candidate talks to the students and postdocs and the professor may or may not ask some of them what they think about the candidate. For most groups, if you are invited to give a talk, you are more than 50% of the time like to have got the job. Also most often you are supposed to find some overlap between your expertise and the professor's project interest beforehand, which is reshaped by the professor in time.
Interview Questions: As a postdoc candidate there is no specific question. You are supposed to show your expertise, self-confidence and enthusiasm for the future possible projects

title: Grants Manager Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for an interview about a week after. Met with the Grants Manager and the Division Business Manager for an interview which lasted about an hour. Advanced to the second round and met with the Division Administrator for an interview which lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: How does organization play a role in your current position, with respect to paying attention to details, and give an example of how you handled making an error that resulted in not being well organized.

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California)
Interview Descriptions: Caltech follows the standard practice for interviewing academic librarians - a full day of individual interviews with key managers, group interviews with peers, and meals with key stakeholders. Be prepared to give a presentation.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1 hour of Skype interview with a professor. I gave a presentation about my master study and my work experience. I had to prepare slides and gave an 1 hour presentation. The admission came after about 10 days after the interview.
Interview Questions: What happens if you shrink transistor size? (e.g. leakage current)

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Caltech’s interview process differs greatly by the department an option that you’re applying to. For me, it was not a technical interview. Most of it was about fit into the program. 

The interview process involves having lunch with faculty, meeting with them one on one, meeting with graduate students in the program, and touring labs. Depending on the department specifics can vary, but from what I know, most interview processes are some variation on the above theme.
Interview Questions: Most questions were not of the technical type, they were simply a conversation about what my interests were and what I wanted to work on. However, I was asked one technical question which was about the class of functions that could be approximated with two or three layer perceptrons.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was referred by my PhD adviser. I was invited for a two-day interview, including a research talk and discussion with all group members. They were all extremely friendly and professional. I enjoyed my time as an interviewee.
Interview Questions: Technical questions regarding my own presentation and research proposal

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I really had no formal interview. I sent my CV by email to the Professor I was interested in and he answered me after 1 week that he was also interested. After that I applied to the graduate program at Caltech and got accepted.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Caltech has a sizable Human Resources department.  I applied for the position in late December and was not contacted until late February.  The HR person who assisted me was very pleasant and detailed and sent over some instructions for the interview; where to park, where to go, etc.  She explained the position thoroughly and advised me to look over their website to become familiar with this famous campus.  

When I arrived, I did not meet the HR person I spoke with, rather I was given a map to go ahead and meet with the interviewer immediately.  The position I was interviewing for was in the division of math, physics and astronomy (so cool!) and their style was very relaxed.  My interview lasted almost two hours, but the interviewer was very welcoming and it helped that their dress code is none.  

Ultimately, I came up short with some of the skills they needed, but overall, it was a basic interview.  

Questions asked: 

Tell me about a particular achievement in your previous job? 
What are your weak points? 
How do you deal with a manager that is practically non-existent? 
Do you work well on your own? 
Tell me why you are the person for this position? 

Hope this helps! I really had a great experience and if you are looking for a position in an academic setting, look into this place.  The campus is beautiful, the people are beyond brainy and the benefits are excellent.  Looks like pay is good too.   Another bonus - not every position has to go through a background check or drug test.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a recent accomplishment in your previous position

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Not all fields have interviews, but for mine it did. They fly you in with other candidates and you meet all the professors and learn about their work. It was a very relaxed feeling but definitely be prepared to tell them about your prior research experiences. Have a few questions to ask about their current projects as well.
Interview Questions: What was your previous research project?

title: Graduate School Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with several different professors. Overall it was fairly easy, but it required a several day campus visit. The questions professors asked centered around academic and research experience, as well as future research goals.
Interview Questions: Future research goals

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: phone interview with two PIs; asked to make a brief presentation about my research; the interviewers kindly explained a hiring mechanism and research atmosphere; after my presentation, the interviewers asked a couple of questions, and told me about potential projects.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hard.... um.... you have to have some luck... Of course your GPA should be top in your school. Also you need to have a lot of other skills like you have won prizes or you have published papers or you have patents...
Interview Questions: Do you use matlab.... what's your background..

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The faculty will ask questions such as "What did you do during your undergrad?", 
"what do you want to do during your graduate school?", and "what are the experiences you find it more difficult?", and so on.
Interview Questions: What did you do during your undergrad?

title: Caltech SURF- Undergraduate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I found my mentor after hearing a lecture he did, emailing him without a response, and ultimately knocking on his door and requesting a research opportunity. Then I was interviewed by a graduate student that I would be working with, if selected. SURF also required an online application once the professor agreed to sponsor me.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were behavioral, but the more difficult questions were about matlab algorithms I would try to use for specific image processing tasks

title: Senior Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (San Jose, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: was great and welcoming. We came and conquered, we ate cake and left. The questions were professional and spot on. Respectful people for a respectful organization. I would recommend you apply and start enjoying your job
Interview Questions: Degree and experience history

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Causal conversation with a bunch of professors in my department. No technical questions are asked -- the "technical" part is assessed during the CV-reading phase of recruitation. The professors want to see whether you "fit in" with the spirit of the school. That means that you need to be smart, confident about your skills, and most of all passionate about science. Broad knowledge about random scientific topics was definitely a plus. If you can hold a conversation about science with a specialist for half an hour, you'll be fine.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in scientifically, describe your favorite research projects, generic talk about my research area.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied through Monster.com, went through a series of three interviews, and was offered the job the day of my last interview. There were 50 applicants, from schools including USC, Berkeley, and UCLA. My state school education was no help, but my enthusiasm was what got me hired.
Interview Questions: What do you think the future of this field of science is?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Claremont, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from Caltech, and I answered questions according to my resume. I think my asset mgmt experience interested them.
Interview Questions: Nothing is difficult. He just asked me about my experience I put on resume.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my background, my motivation for applying, how I would make use of my time during my job, I was interested in the field I was applying for and if there was anything else that i wanted to add or if I had any questions. The interview was short, only about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your motivation for applying for this job?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard and occurred over telecon.  Questions were strictly related to my qualifications regarding the specific job I applied for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant  Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: The process was quite involved and required alot of effort on my part to see any action. It was weeks inbetween interactions for a position that I was told by the hiring manager needed to be filled as soon as possible. When I did finally get an interview the interviewers acted extremely hostile.
Interview Questions: How regimented do you like your work schedule, 1 being total adherence to all regulations without question and 10 being completely lax of all rules. Please keep in mind that we are a very sternly run facility

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: The culture is very informal, the opposite of bureaucratic.  The interview included a tour of campus, description of research topics, and an introduction to other graduate students and support staff.  The application process typically does not include an interview, but one can be requested for those who are seriously candidates.
Interview Questions: Potential approaches to a partial differential equation

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Caltech (California) (Pasadena, CA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was administrative and technical position. Though it was not required to have technical backgroup, it was preferred. I had an interview with one faculty member who was the one to work with. Since I did not have any science and engineerring background and worked at Caltech, no offer was the result.
Interview Questions: N/A
